channel.title: -OpenVpn- disconnected vpn server at few time
channel.description:
Hello, Thanks 4 all, first I'm sorry if this question is in wrong place
I'm a glad user of whonix, but I have a problem with openvpn, all vpn server that use disconnect in few time, sometimes in seconds... Seriously, it's madness, and not have many experience with openvpn
I use openvpn in console how root, when the vpn is being disconnected, throw this message in console
Wed Oct 1 16:06:04 2014 Initialization Sequence Completed Wed Oct 1 16:36:00 2014 Connection reset, restarting [-1] Wed Oct 1 16:36:00 2014 TCP/UDP: Closing socket Wed Oct 1 16:36:00 2014 SIGUSR1[soft,connection-reset] received, process restarting Wed Oct 1 16:36:00 2014 Restart pause, 5 second(s) Wed Oct 1 16:36:05 2014 WARNING: No server certificate verification method has been enabled. See http://openvpn.net/howto.html#mitm for more info. Wed Oct 1 16:36:05 2014 NOTE: the current --script-security setting may allow this configuration to call user-defined scripts Wed Oct 1 16:36:05 2014 Re-using SSL/TLS context Wed Oct 1 16:36:05 2014 Control Channel MTU parms [ L:1559 D:140 EF:40 EB:0 ET:0 EL:0 ] Wed Oct 1 16:36:05 2014 Socket Buffers: R=[87380->131072] S=[16384->131072]

item.title: -OpenVpn- disconnected vpn server at few time
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
UDP over Tor (user -> Tor -> VPN -> destination) won’t work, because the Tor network does not yet support UDP. Try using TCP mode.

Also do you know our documentation on VPN’s already?

Whonix – 19 Apr 20
